content.description:
Climb up and left from belay past gear and 3 bolts, traverse left 1 meter and make way up right angling crack until you reach bolts. Move up past edges to the top. 2 bolt belay. It's possible to rap down to belay from here and make one more rappel down with 70 meter rope to the base of cliff. From here walk down and right to get back to transmission line.

Climb starts at the end of the traverse pitch on Tortuga.
mixed

climbs.name: Mammacita
climbs.fa: J Lecuyer ,M Lecuyer, & A Lecuyer June 2018

content.description:
Pitch 1  15 meters 5.9+ 2 bolts 
Climb up and left 4th class using the large crack for your feet up to a tree, make a few moves up to a left facing corner with 2 bolts. Make steep moves up corner and top out on right at a 2 bolt belay. (when wet it’s easy to A0 this to get to belay).
Pitch 2 30 meters mixed 5.8 
Climb up right facing corner up to ledge. Clip bolt on your left and make your way up to the finger crack above. Follow crack up to 2 bolt belay on ledge. 
Pitch 3 25 meters mixed 5.9 
Climb up making slab moves past 5 bolts up to a small overhang, climb through overhang and up to bolt above (I left the old button head in for historic preservation). Make moves up to a short crack (that takes a small cam) climb past this to a ledge with a 2 bolts belay.
Pitch 4 bolts 
Climb out right from belay until it is possible to climb up on face. Make you way upward past bolts on amazing face holds up to 2 bolt belay above on top of the feature.

Approach as for Tortuga you make your way up to the base above the rock quarry. Rather than continue up the gully to fixed rope traverse right through trees to a left facing corner (very short 5 meters long). You can get ready here.
mixed

climbs.name: Tortuga
climbs.fa: A.Lecuyer, G. Maquaid, D. Helm May 2018

content.description:
Pitch 1 15 meters 5.7 bolts, Move up ledges making way to a short arete climb up to treed ledge. Look for bolt on wall for directional. 2 boltbelay off to right at start of traverse pitch.
Pitch 2 35 meters 5.9 mixed The money pitch! Traverse out past bolt following weekness to a 2 bolt belay. Make sure you protect traverse for your second the end can be rather exciting if you don't.
Pitch 3 15 meters 5.5 gear (bring a #4) Climb up to large crack then up to large tree on ledge. Belay off tree.
Pitch 4 20 meters 5.10+ Climb up steep jugs to base of corner. Follow corner past bolts to 2 bolt belay above.
Decent Traverse over to gulley and make way through trees to 2 bolt belay at the top of Mammacita. Rap down.

Climb up talus field from power line to the gully on climbers left of the image. In the spring there is a water fall coming down the gully. If you in the right gully you will find a fixed line (Red rope April 2018). This brings you to the right side of the gully above a bluff of moss covered rock. Next ascend the fixed line to the right of the gullet for 25 meters to a ledge. If you don't want to hang onto rope you can alternatively climb up same feature past bolts (5th class).
Mixed bolts and gear.

This feature has one of the most amazing traverse pitch on Copper Mountain. You can see the scrubbed moss line from Terrace, under the lichen and moss is beautiful white granite that when exposed to the sun looks sun bleached. The feature offers mixed gear and bolt climbing. Some of the face climbing is very featured with good position, almost all the belays are on very large comfortable ledges. It doesn't get much better!
On a final note don’t be scared off by the grades the cruxes are short lives and well protected.
